blocks.value: Saint Philomena was a young virgin martyr of the early Church. Her relics were discovered in Rome in 1802, and countless miracles followed, earning her the title 'The Wonder-Worker.'

Through private revelation, it was learned that Philomena was a Greek princess who consecrated her virginity to Christ. When Emperor Diocletian sought to marry her, she refused. He subjected her to torture: arrows, drowning, and scourging, but angels protected her each time.

Finally martyred by beheading at age 13, Philomena became a favorite saint of the Cur√© of Ars, who attributed countless miracles to her intercession. She was also beloved by St. John Vianney, who called her 'my dear little saint.'
